description:
The final season of Fairy Tail.

Fairy Tail has been disbanded. A year later, Lucy comes into contact with Natsu and Happy. The three of them try to find the other former members' whereabouts to reconstruct the guild as they seek the real reason behind the guild's disbandment.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiro_mashima)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQLYbIvGWtClestisnB1_6A)__

Japanese manga artist most known for his manga Groove Adventure Rave, published by Kodansha's Weekly Shonen Magazine, from 1999 to 2005. The series was later adapted into an anime. However, the anime adaption was cancelled before it could complete the series.

In 2003, he collected some of his one-shot titles in two volumes: Mashima-en- Vol.1 & 2. Those stories include, among others, Cocona, "Xmas Hearts" and "Fairy Tail", a sort of prototype for his last work.

In 2006, he began his now finished series, Fairy Tail, serialized in Kodansha's Weekly Shonen Magazine. He also published the manga Monster Hunter Orage.

Hiro Mashima was a notable guest at the 2008 San Diego Comic-Con. He has one daughter.

His artwork and [Oda Eiichiro](https://anilist.co/staff/96881/EiichiroOda)'s are greatly similar, but that is due to both of them being influenced largely by [Toriyama Akira](https://anilist.co/staff/96901/AkiraToriyama)'s work growing up.

His former assistant was [Yoshikawa Miki](https://anilist.co/staff/98703/MikiYoshikawa) author of Yankee-kun to Megane-chan.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dmpmutation)

**Shinji Ishihira** is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [producer](https://anilist.co/staff/155544/)._
Satou Shigetoshi (佐藤成俊) is a Japanese producer and production manager.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Beverly_avex) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/beverly_official_/) Filipino pop singer based in Japan under the Avex Trax label. For her solo debut, she sang "Everlasting Sky", the theme song for Kamen Rider Build, Be The One and subsequently released her debut solo album titled 24.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

__[Website](https://www.miyunamiyuna.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyunasinger)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLZ2RXLLVx0jAl0jxe7QzyQ)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miyuna_miyuna/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/miyuna67/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2eg5oiMWKYEJ5vVwW1YFCC?)__

__Date of Birth:__ June 7, 2002
__Birthplace:__ Miyazaki Prefecture, Japan

__Introduction:__
Miyuna is a Japanese singer-songwriter affiliated with record label [A.S.A.B](https://www.asab.online/) (2019-), while having previously been under record label [Here, play pop!](http://www.playpop.org/) since her debut in 2018. 

__Biography:__
Miyuna became familiar with the rock, soul and pop genre from early childhood, which is particularily due to her parents playing western music during travels. Her parents would often listen to Whitney Houston and Michael Jackson, and as a result she became interested in soul and pop type music. She has also mentioned that her grandmother liked the artist [Hibari Misora](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hibari_Misora).

In elementary school Miyuna started listening to [ONE OK ROCK](https://anilist.co/staff/126954/ONE-OK-ROCK) and became interested in rock, specifically full-fledged rock. Continuing her descent into rock, in junior high school she started listening to the rock band [coldrain](https://anilist.co/staff/105449/Coldrain), which bloomed an interest in more sub-genres of rock. She also seems to listen to various artists, regardless of genre - as an example she mentioned that she has listened to [Kouji Tamaki](https://anilist.co/staff/112133), [Toshinobu Kubota](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toshinobu_Kubota), [Ringo Shiina](https://anilist.co/staff/103213/Ringo-Shiina), the band [Petrolz](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%83%9A%E3%83%88%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC%E3%83%AB%E3%82%BA) (stylized as PETROLZ), [Yu Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/116399/Yu-Takahashi), [Nakamura Emi](https://anilist.co/staff/138586/NakamuraEmi) and VOCALOID-type stuff.

She initially found success with her first two singles, "[Gamushara](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TciQvQFTzHo)" and "[Tenjou Tenge](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fZK5LKN4tek)", which were used as the fifth opening and ending theme songs to the anime [Black Clover](https://anilist.co/anime/97940/Black-Clover/). Her third single, "[Boku to Kimi no Lullaby](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GH7cWANydnQ)" was used as the twenty-fifth ending theme song to the anime [Fairy Tail](https://anilist.co/anime/6702/Fairy-Tail/), or alternatively known as the third ending theme song to the 2018 season of [Fairy Tail](https://anilist.co/anime/99749/Fairy-Tail-2018/), and the fourth single, "[Yurareru](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wOAz7xkukrY)", was used as the theme song for the 2019 Japanese remake of the Korean film Blind. She continues to release demos for her songs on the independent Japanese music platform Eggs.

(Source: [Wikipedia (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miyuna), edited)

**Birthplace:** Niihama City, Ehime Prefecture, Japan
**Hometown:** Osaka Prefecture, Japan
**Likes:** Yakifu, Niihama City, Traveling
**Dislikes:** Natto

**[Artist Profile (avex)](https://avex.jp/miyuu/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyuuamazing)** | **[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2vMy0jDGhg0N5K0nqEQ6Jw)** | **[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/MIYUUamazing/)**

**Introduction:**
Miyuu is a Japanese singer-songwriter signed under record label avex trax. She has a smoky and gentle singing voice and the combination of her Kyoto and Western-style music has attracted the attention of not only the Japanese, but also people from overseas. She is currently active as a musician through live performances in Osaka and Tokyo, while still following her roots and doing music videos on her YouTube channel.

**Biography:**
She started her career doing covers of songs and uploading them to her YouTube channel which was initially created on August 18, 2015. The covers she did included songs like "Maps", "Sugar" and "Payphone" by the Maroon 5 and "Just The Way You Are", "When I Was Your Man" and "Count On Me", by Bruno Mars. The channel was re-branded on February 6, 2016, as a result of her success in the indie music industry, and shortly after the channel was established she participated in the "YouTuber Women's Audition" sponsored by record label avex and company UUUM. She won the grand prize, and was selected to be the winner, which in return made her sign a contract with the record label avex management. 

In addition to doing these covers, she would make them special by recording them like a "travel blog" of sorts in front of shrines and temples in Kyoto, greeting and talking to people while recording footage for her videos, which can be seen in the first upload of the cover "[Sugar](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MBVpfcGQajE)" by Maroon 5. She has also stated that she enjoys traveling, which explains the format of her cover videos, and she hopes to become a goodwill and tourism ambassador in her favorite place, Niihama City in the Ehime Prefecture, specifically her birthplace.

Miyuu released her first digital single titled "Southern Waves" on September 7, 2016, then she made her indie debut with the indie album EP "Where we'll be" on December 21, 2016. She released her second digital single titled "into you" on August 9, 2017. 

She made a major debut in the anime industry with her performance of the song "[Exceed](https://anidb.net/song/102404)", which was used as the fourth ending to the anime *[Fairy Tail (2018)](https://anilist.co/anime/99749/Fairy-Tail-2018/)*. She would later do an inserted song performance in the anime [revisions](https://anilist.co/anime/102835/Revisions/).

(Source: [ja.wikipedia.org](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miyuu) | [Miyuu's Official YouTube Channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2vMy0jDGhg0N5K0nqEQ6Jw/about))

[Website](http://www.empire-official.com/)

EMPiRE is an idol group formed on August 23, 2017. It was formed by WACK and avex, is known formerly as Project aW, and features members from the WACK auditions earlier in the year.

Full name: Brand-new idol SHiT (Shinsei Kuso Idol, 新生クソアイドル)

A Japanese idol group that was founded in 2015 by their manager Watanabe Junnosuke.
